title: Trump warns of 'NUCLEAR HOLOCAUST like no other' if US & Russia do not improve relations
text:
GETTY Could Russia and the US be set for a nuclear war? 
He responded: “It would be so easy for me to [say] the tougher I am on Russia the better. 
“We’re a very powerful nuclear country, and so are they. 
"If we have a good relationship with Russia, believe me, that's a good thing. Not a bad thing." GETTY Trump made the claims during a hostile press conference Do these photos show America preparing for war with Russia? Wed, January 18, 2017 A photographer has captured what he says is an F-16 jet practicing dogfights with a mysterious Russian fighter plane – before returning to Area 51. Play slideshow 1 of 24 
In recent days Russia jets were accused of flying too close to the USS Porter in the Black Sea, while Moscow has also deployed a spy ship just off the US East Coast. 
Putin was also accused of deploying a new nuclear missile , which would violate the Cold War arms treaty between the two countries. 
Relations between the two leaders appeared to have started well after the White House hailed a “ positive call ” between Trump and Putin just days after the President was inaugurated. 
In a statement, the White House said: “The positive call was a significant start to improving the relationship between the United States and Russia that is in need of repair. GETTY The North Korean missile launch last weekend has put world leaders on edge 
“Both President Trump and President Putin are hopeful that after today's call the two sides can move quickly to tackle terrorism and other important issues of mutual concern.” 
Following an attempted nuclear launch by North Korea on Sunday, nations across the world have been discussing the best way to respond to nuclear threats. 
Whether Trump is prepared to launch US missiles to quell the North Korean threat remains to be seen. Related articles
